Package monopoly

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • monopoly.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Covers game logic and turn order.
    Version:
    7/20/2019
    Author:
    Ben Burger, Ian Hall-Watt, Reuben Nyenhuis

      • rollDice

        public int rollDice()
        Rolls two dice and gets the sum.
        Returns:
        Total of two six sided dice rolls

      • move

        public int move()
        Moves a player 2d6 spaces on the board.
        Returns:
        number of spaces moved

      • buyProperty

        public int buyProperty()
        The current player becomes the owner of the property that he is currently on. That properties price is taken out of the player's money.
        Returns:
        price - the price for the property

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        Changes the current player to the next one in order.

      • propertyActions

        public int propertyActions()
        Gets the proper possible action for the space landed on by a player.
        Returns:
        0: Nothing to buy and no rent to pay. Do nothing 1: Unowned property. Prompt to buy. 2: Owned property or other payment to be made. Prompt for payment.

      • payRent

        public boolean payRent()
        Current player pays rent of landed property.
        Returns:
        True if player goes bankrupt. False otherwise.

      • calculateRent

        public int calculateRent()
        Calculates amount of rent owed, taking into account owning all properties of one color or owning multiple railroads.
        Returns:
        Total rent owed.

      • createProperties

        private void createProperties()
        Populates board with properties as in Monopoly. Owner being -1 indicates a rent payment that goes to none of the players. Utilities and railroads currently set to a flat rate of $25 for rent.
